qas.question: What does Himachal have a rich heritage of?
Has the demand increased or decreased for handcrafts?
Has the demand increased inside or outside the country?
What does Kangra have a rich heritage of?

plausible_answers.text: wood work, horse-hair bangles, wooden and metal utensils

qas.question: What are three examples of handicrafts from Gompa?

plausible_answers.text: competition from machine made goods and also because of lack of marketing facilities

qas.question: Why did the production of woolen and pashmina shawls decline?

plausible_answers.text: increased within and outside the country

qas.question: What has happened to the sale of grass shoes in Kangra?
Has the demand for horese-hair bangles increased or decreased?

context: Himachal has a rich heritage of <a0_0><b5_0>handicrafts<b5_0/><a0_0/>. These include <a1_0>woolen and pashmina shawls<a1_0/>, carpets, silver and metal ware, embroidered chappals, grass shoes, Kangra and Gompa style paintings, <b6_0>wood work, horse-hair bangles, wooden and metal utensils<b6_0/> and various other house hold items. These <a3_0>aesthetic and tasteful handicrafts<a3_0/> declined under <b7_0>competition from machine made goods and also because of lack of marketing facilities<b7_0/>. But now the demand for handicrafts has <a2_0><b8_0><b9_0>increased<b9_0/><a2_0/> <a4_0>within and outside the country<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
